channel.title: Only In America: 350 Years of the American Jewish Experience
channel.description: 350 Years of the American Jewish Experience

item.title: The First Jews
item.description: Their long climb from poverty to prominence and prosperity in the New World.

item.title: The Streets Were Paved With Gold: A Journey Through The Jewish Lower East Side of New York, Part 1
item.description: The Lower East Side: tenements, sweat shops, and labor unions.

item.title: Becoming Americans: A Journey Through The Jewish Lower East Side of New York, Part 2
item.description: The Lower East Side: The Yiddish Theater and assimilation into American Culture.

item.title: White Christmas: The Story of the Jews Who Created Tin Pan Alley and Hollywood Part 1
item.description: Jewish Immigrants like Irving Berlin, Harold Arlen, George and Ira Gershwin defined American Popular Music

item.title: Over The Rainbow: The Jews Who Created Tin Pan Alley and Hollywood, Part 2
item.description: Yiddish-speaking moguls created Hollywood, then distilled the American dream, and gave it back to mainstream America.

item.title: No Dogs or Jews Allowed: The Story of Anti-Semitism in America
item.description: Producer and host Larry Josephson narrates this moving account of a dark period in American Jewish History.

item.title: Never Again! A Holocaust Memorial featuring Eli Wiesel
item.description: A one hour special that includes Larry Josephson's recent exclusive interview with Elie Wiesel, a holocaust survivor and winner of the Nobel Peace Prize for his work on behalf of humanity

item.title: An Interview with Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg
item.description: This conversation offers a rare personal look into the life of sitting Justice of the Supreme Court, her struggles against gender discrimination, antisemitism and severe illness.

item.title: A Conversation with Michael Steinhardt
item.description: Michael Steinhardt's life exemplifies one of the themes of ONLY IN AMERICA - those who started with very little and who made it big, often under difficult circumstances.

item.title: A Conversation with Ambassador John L. Loeb, Jr.
item.description: Ambassador John L. Loeb Jr., has had a distinguished career in both the private and public sectors. In this interview, John Loeb Jr. brings to life his many ancestors (and other well-known Jewish figures) from the Colonial Times to the Revolutionary War. He also shares some of his challenges growing up in a privileged American Jewish family, including his own experience with anti-Semitism at the elite private school, Hotchkiss, in the 1940's.
